Setting Up the Flux Condenser
Install Grids and Connect Non-Corrupt Source Elements:

Place Grids on the Flux Condenser to help it absorb the Flux more efficiently.
Surround the condenser with Non-Corrupt Source Elements , such as Ignis, Aqua, Terra, etc., to ensure it works properly. These elements help the condenser process and condense the Flux.

Set Up a Pollution Source Container:

Beneath the condenser, place a container that will store the Polluted Source Elements. The polluted elements will be transferred here once absorbed by the condenser.

Efficiency of the Condenser:

The more Condenser Grids you install, the more efficient the condenser becomes. This means less non-corrupt source energy will be needed to clean more Flux.
As you improve the condenser's setup, it will clean Flux in a larger area, making it more effective for larger regions.
Maintenance of the Flux Condenser

Grid Clogging:

Grids have a chance of clogging as they absorb Flux. When this happens, you will need to repair them.
To repair the clogged grids, Right-Click them with a Source Element Filter. This operation will consume the Source Element Filter, so be sure to stock up on them.

Avoid Using Polluted Source Elements:

Do not input Polluted Source Elements into the Flux Condenser, as this will immediately clog the grids. Make sure only non-corrupt source energy is used in the process.

Warning:
Be cautious and avoid using polluted energy in the system as it can cause the Flux Condenser to malfunction. Ensure you use only clean, non-corrupt source elements for optimal performance.
